title: H01-1049

sentences.text: Listen-Communicate-Show -LRB- LCS -RRB- is a new paradigm for human interaction with data sources .
We integrate a spoken language understanding system with intelligent mobile agents that mediate between users and information sources .
We have built and will demonstrate an application of this approach called LCS-Marine .
Using LCS-Marine , tactical personnel can converse with their logistics system to place a supply or information request .
The request is passed to a mobile , intelligent agent for execution at the appropriate database .
Requestors can also instruct the system to notify them when the status of a request changes or when a request is complete .
We have demonstrated this capability in several field exercises with the Marines and are currently developing applications of this technology in new domains .

Entity-listen-communicate-show_-lrb-_lcs.label: Listen-Communicate-Show -LRB- LCS -RRB-
Entity-listen-communicate-show_-lrb-_lcs.description: Listen-Communicate-Show (LCS) is a novel paradigm designed to enhance human interaction with data sources through the integration of spoken language understanding and intelligent mobile agents, facilitating conversational requests and notifications in applications like LCS-Marine.

Entity-this_approach.label: this approach
Entity-this_approach.description: This approach refers to the Listen-Communicate-Show (LCS) methodology, which integrates spoken language understanding with intelligent mobile agents to facilitate human interaction with data sources, exemplified by the LCS-Marine application.

Entity-listen-communicate-show.label: Listen-Communicate-Show
Entity-listen-communicate-show.description: Listen-Communicate-Show (LCS) is a novel interaction paradigm that combines spoken language understanding with intelligent mobile agents to facilitate user communication with data sources.

Entity-lcs.label: LCS
Entity-lcs.description: LCS stands for Listen-Communicate-Show, which is a new paradigm designed to enhance human interaction with data sources through the integration of spoken language understanding systems and intelligent mobile agents.

Entity-this_capability.label: this capability
Entity-this_capability.description: This capability refers to the demonstrated ability of the Listen-Communicate-Show (LCS) system to facilitate human interaction with data sources through spoken language understanding and intelligent mobile agents, specifically in the context of logistics requests during field exercises with the Marines.

Entity-lcs-marine.label: LCS-Marine
Entity-lcs-marine.description: LCS-Marine is a software application designed to facilitate conversational interactions between tactical personnel and logistics systems, enabling users to place supply or information requests through a spoken language interface integrated with intelligent mobile agents.

Entity-application_of_this_technology.label: applications of this technology
Entity-application_of_this_technology.description: The term 'applications of this technology' refers to the various uses and implementations of the Listen-Communicate-Show (LCS) paradigm, particularly in enhancing human interaction with data sources through spoken language understanding and intelligent mobile agents in diverse fields beyond military logistics.

Entity-supply_or_information_request.label: supply or information request
Entity-supply_or_information_request.description: A supply or information request refers to a formal inquiry made by tactical personnel within the LCS-Marine system to their logistics system, enabling them to obtain necessary supplies or information through a conversational interface with an intelligent mobile agent.

Entity-request.label: request
Entity-request.description: The request refers to a supply or information inquiry made by tactical personnel using the LCS-Marine application, which is processed by a mobile intelligent agent for execution at a database.

Entity-requestors.label: Requestors
Entity-requestors.description: Requestors are users, specifically tactical personnel, who interact with the LCS-Marine system to place supply or information requests and receive notifications about the status of those requests.

Entity-information_request.label: information request
Entity-information_request.description: An information request refers to a formal inquiry made by tactical personnel within the LCS-Marine system to obtain specific data or supplies from a logistics database through conversational interaction.

Entity-mobile.label: mobile
Entity-mobile.description: The term 'mobile' refers to an intelligent agent that operates dynamically to facilitate communication and execution of requests between users and information sources in the context of the LCS-Marine application.

Entity-the_system.label: the system
Entity-the_system.description: the system refers to the logistics system that tactical personnel interact with through the LCS-Marine application to manage supply and information requests.

Entity-user.label: users
Entity-user.description: The term 'users' refers to individuals or stakeholders who interact with the intelligent mobile agents and information sources in the context of the Listen-Communicate-Show (LCS) system.

Entity-human_interaction_with_data_sourc.label: human interaction with data sources
Entity-human_interaction_with_data_sourc.description: Human interaction with data sources refers to the innovative paradigm of engaging users with information systems through spoken language understanding and intelligent mobile agents, enabling seamless communication and request management for data retrieval and status updates.

Entity-several_field_exercise.label: several field exercises
Entity-several_field_exercise.description: Several field exercises refer to practical demonstrations conducted with the Marines to showcase the capabilities of the LCS-Marine application, which integrates spoken language understanding with intelligent mobile agents for logistics communication.

Entity-tactical_personnel.label: tactical personnel
Entity-tactical_personnel.description: Tactical personnel refers to military individuals, specifically those involved in operational roles within the Marines, who utilize the LCS-Marine system to interact with logistics for supply and information requests.

Entity-technology.label: technology
Entity-technology.description: The technology refers to the integration of a spoken language understanding system with intelligent mobile agents designed to facilitate human interaction with data sources, specifically in the context of logistics and supply requests for tactical personnel.

Entity-application.label: applications
Entity-application.description: The term 'applications' refers to the various uses and implementations of the Listen-Communicate-Show technology in different domains beyond its initial demonstration with the Marines.

Entity-system.label: system
Entity-system.description: The 'system' refers to a logistics management software that allows tactical personnel to interactively place supply or information requests and receive notifications about their status.

Entity-the_status_of_a_request.label: the status of a request
Entity-the_status_of_a_request.description: The status of a request refers to the current state or progress of a user's supply or information request within the LCS-Marine system, indicating whether it is pending, completed, or has changed in some way.

Entity-the_appropriate_database.label: the appropriate database
Entity-the_appropriate_database.description: the appropriate database refers to the specific data repository that the mobile intelligent agent accesses to execute supply or information requests made by tactical personnel using the LCS-Marine application.

Entity-spoken_language_understanding_sys.label: spoken language understanding system
Entity-spoken_language_understanding_sys.description: A spoken language understanding system is a technology designed to interpret and process human speech in order to facilitate communication between users and computer systems.

Entity-status.label: status
Entity-status.description: The term 'status' refers to the current state or condition of a request within the LCS-Marine system, indicating whether it has changed or been completed.

Entity-a_request.label: a request
Entity-a_request.description: A request refers to a formal inquiry or demand made by users, specifically tactical personnel in this context, to a logistics system for supplies or information, which is then processed by an intelligent mobile agent.

Entity-domain.label: domains
Entity-domain.description: The term 'domains' refers to various new areas of application or fields where the technology developed in the paper, specifically the Listen-Communicate-Show paradigm, is being implemented beyond its initial military context.

Entity-new_domain.label: new domains
Entity-new_domain.description: new domains refers to the various application areas where the Listen-Communicate-Show technology is being developed and implemented beyond its initial military context.

Entity-human_interaction.label: human interaction
Entity-human_interaction.description: Human interaction refers to the ways in which individuals communicate and engage with one another, encompassing various forms of social interaction and communication methods.

Entity-logistics_system.label: logistics system
Entity-logistics_system.description: A logistics system is an integrated network of processes and resources designed to manage the flow of goods, information, and services from point of origin to point of consumption.

Entity-intelligent_mobile_agent.label: intelligent mobile agents
Entity-intelligent_mobile_agent.description: Intelligent mobile agents are autonomous software programs that can move across networks to perform tasks on behalf of users, utilizing artificial intelligence to adapt and respond to their environment.

Entity-mobile__intelligent_agent.label: mobile, intelligent agent
Entity-mobile__intelligent_agent.description: A mobile, intelligent agent is a software program or system that can autonomously perform tasks and make decisions while being capable of moving between different environments or platforms.

Entity-information_source.label: information sources
Entity-information_source.description: Information sources are entities or resources that provide data or knowledge, which can be utilized for decision-making, research, or understanding various topics.

Entity-database.label: database
Entity-database.description: A database is an organized collection of structured information or data, typically stored electronically in a computer system, that allows for efficient retrieval, management, and updating of data.

Entity-intelligent_agent.label: intelligent agent
Entity-intelligent_agent.description: An intelligent agent is a software program or system that autonomously perceives its environment, makes decisions, and takes actions to achieve specific goals, often utilizing artificial intelligence techniques.

Entity-data_source.label: data sources
Entity-data_source.description: Data sources are entities or repositories that provide information or data for analysis, research, or decision-making.

Entity-marine.label: Marines
Entity-marine.description: The Marines refer to a branch of the military that specializes in amphibious operations and is known for its rapid response and combat readiness.

Entity-field_exercise.label: field exercises
Entity-field_exercise.description: Field exercises are practical training activities conducted in outdoor environments, typically involving military personnel to enhance their skills and operational readiness.

summary: Listen-Communicate-Show -LRB- LCS -RRB- is a new paradigm for human interaction with data sources . We integrate a spoken language understanding system with intelligent mobile agents that mediate between users and information sources . We have built and will demonstrate an application of this approach called LCS-Marine . Using LCS-Marine , tactical personnel can converse with their logistics system to place a supply or information request . The request is passed to a mobile , intelligent agent for execution at the appropriate database . Requestors can also instruct the system to notify them when the status of a request changes or when a request is complete . We have demonstrated this capability in several field exercises with the Marines and are currently developing applications of this technology in new domains .

Predicate-is_a_paradigm_for.label: is a paradigm for
Predicate-is_a_paradigm_for.description: The predicate 'is a paradigm for' establishes a relationship where the subject serves as a model or example that embodies the principles, characteristics, or practices represented by the object. It indicates that the subject exemplifies or illustrates the broader concept or phenomenon described by the object, suggesting that the subject can be used as a reference point for understanding or analyzing the object.

Predicate-integrates_with.label: integrates with
Predicate-integrates_with.description: The predicate 'integrates with' denotes a relationship where the subject and object are combined or coordinated in a way that allows them to function together effectively. This integration implies a mutual enhancement of capabilities, where the subject and object work in conjunction to achieve a common goal or improve overall performance. It suggests a seamless interaction that facilitates the exchange of information, resources, or functionalities between the two entities.

Predicate-mediate_between.label: mediate between
Predicate-mediate_between.description: The predicate 'mediate between' indicates a relational function where the subject acts as an intermediary or facilitator that connects, communicates, or negotiates interactions, information, or relationships between the subject and the object. It implies a role of bridging or reconciling differences, ensuring that the needs or actions of the object are addressed or understood through the influence or actions of the subject.

Predicate-called.label: called
Predicate-called.description: The predicate 'called' serves to establish a naming relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is referred to or identified by the name provided in the object. It connects the two by asserting that the subject has been designated or labeled with the term represented by the object.

Predicate-is_called.label: is called
Predicate-is_called.description: The predicate 'is called' serves to establish a naming relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is referred to or identified by the name or term represented by the object. It connects the two by asserting that the subject has a specific designation or label, which is the object.

Predicate-converse_with.label: converse with
Predicate-converse_with.description: The predicate 'converse with' indicates a communicative interaction between the subject and the object, where the subject engages in dialogue or exchange of information with the object. This interaction can involve sharing ideas, discussing strategies, or providing updates, and it implies a two-way communication process that facilitates understanding or collaboration between the entities involved.

Predicate-place.label: place
Predicate-place.description: The predicate 'place' indicates the action of positioning or situating the subject in relation to the object. In this context, it signifies that the subject, which can be a person, group, or entity, is associated with or is responsible for a specific location or context concerning the object, which represents a request for resources or information. This relationship highlights the role of the subject in the operational or logistical framework involving the object.

Predicate-is_passed_to.label: is passed to
Predicate-is_passed_to.description: The predicate 'is passed to' indicates a transfer or transmission of an entity (the subject) to another entity (the object). It signifies that the subject is being directed, delivered, or conveyed to the object, which typically represents a recipient or a target that will receive or handle the subject.

Predicate-executes_at.label: executes at
Predicate-executes_at.description: The predicate 'executes at' establishes a relationship between a subject and an object, indicating the specific location or context in which an action or process carried out by the subject takes place. It implies that the subject, which can be an entity such as a system or agent, performs a function or task at the designated object, which typically represents a resource, environment, or platform necessary for the execution of that action.

Predicate-instruct.label: instruct
Predicate-instruct.description: The predicate 'instruct' denotes an action where the subject imparts knowledge, guidance, or commands to the object, which is typically a system, individual, or entity. This action involves the subject providing specific information or directives that the object is expected to follow or implement.

Predicate-notify.label: notify
Predicate-notify.description: The predicate 'notify' indicates an action where the subject communicates information or alerts to the object. It implies that the subject is responsible for conveying a message or update, ensuring that the object is made aware of specific details or events.

Predicate-changes.label: changes
Predicate-changes.description: The predicate 'changes' indicates a transformation or alteration that occurs between the subject and the object. It signifies that the subject undergoes a modification that affects the state, condition, or characteristics of the object, resulting in a new or different state. This relationship highlights the dynamic nature of the subject in relation to the object, emphasizing the process of change.

Predicate-is_complete.label: is complete
Predicate-is_complete.description: The predicate 'is complete' indicates that the subject has reached a state of fulfillment or finality, signifying that all necessary components or requirements have been satisfied. It connects the subject to the object by asserting that the object's condition or status reflects this state of completeness.

Predicate-can_instruct.label: can instruct
Predicate-can_instruct.description: The predicate 'can instruct' indicates the ability or capacity of the subject to provide guidance, direction, or commands to the object. It implies that the subject possesses the knowledge or authority necessary to influence the behavior or operation of the object, facilitating a transfer of information or control.

Predicate-demonstrated_in.label: demonstrated in
Predicate-demonstrated_in.description: The predicate 'demonstrated in' indicates that the subject has shown or proven its qualities, characteristics, or effectiveness through specific instances or contexts represented by the object. It establishes a relationship where the subject's attributes are validated or evidenced by the examples or scenarios provided in the object.

Predicate-developing_applications_of.label: developing applications of
Predicate-developing_applications_of.description: The predicate 'developing applications of' signifies the process of creating practical uses or implementations for a particular subject in various contexts or fields. It connects the subject, which represents a specific area of knowledge, resource, or innovation, with the object, which denotes the new areas or domains where these applications can be utilized. This relationship highlights the transformative potential of the subject in expanding its relevance and functionality across different sectors.

Predicate-refers_to.label: refers to
Predicate-refers_to.description: The predicate 'refers to' establishes a relationship where the subject is associated with or denotes the object, indicating that the subject is a representation, mention, or indication of the object in a specific context.

Predicate-is_a_novel_interaction_paradig.label: is a novel interaction paradigm that enhances human interaction with data sources
Predicate-is_a_novel_interaction_paradig.description: This predicate describes a framework or approach that significantly improves the way individuals engage with and utilize various data sources. It emphasizes the innovative nature of the interaction paradigm, suggesting that it introduces new methods or techniques that facilitate better communication and understanding between humans and data. The subject, which represents a specific system or method, is characterized by this predicate as being effective in enhancing the overall experience of interacting with data, thereby making it more intuitive and accessible.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a more specific instance or category that falls under the wider category represented by the object. This relationship suggests that the object encompasses a broader scope or definition that includes the subject as a subset.
